Constructor Detail

Spreadsheet

public Spreadsheet()
a generic constructor

Spreadsheet

public Spreadsheet(java.lang.String file)
Creates and instance of this class and reads in the given file. The files should be a simple ASCII delimited file of columns of data where the first row contains the column names (fieldnames)

Parameters:
file - the fully qualified filename to read

Spreadsheet

public Spreadsheet(java.lang.String file,
                   java.lang.String version)
Creates and instance of this class and reads in the given file. The files should be a simple ASCII delimited file of columns of data where the first row contains the column names (fieldnames)

Parameters:
file - the fully qualified filename to read
version - the 'SoftwareVersion' number from the context file

setDataColumn

public boolean setDataColumn(int colIndex,
                             java.lang.String[] value)
Sets the values in a column of vData. Be advised that no check is made to ensure that the vData and values have the same number of elements.

Parameters:
colIndex - the index of the column to set.
value - the values to assign to the elements in the column
Returns:
a boolean indicating success

prependToFieldname

public boolean prependToFieldname(java.lang.String prependString)
Prepends the specified string to each fieldname. For example, to prepend "FIT_" to each fieldname do ... objref.prependToFieldname("FIT_")

Parameters:
prependString - the String to prepend with

getFieldIndex

public int getFieldIndex(java.lang.String fieldname)
Returns the index of the field that matches the provided string (case independent)

Parameters:
fieldname - the name of the field index to fetch
Returns:
returns the zero based index of the field that matches that proved string OR -1 upon failure

join

public boolean join()
If the rows of data and the fieldnames are held as String Arrays then this method will join them with the delimiter

Returns:
a boolean indicating success
See Also:
split()

join

public java.lang.String join(java.lang.String[] arg)
Joins any given string array using the current delimiter

Parameters:
arg - A String array
Returns:
a String of the input concatenated using the delimiter

split

public boolean split()
Splits the strings data and fieldnames into string arrays using the specified delimiter. If the data are already split then it returns immediately, with little overhead to call this method - call it often.

Returns:
a boolean indicating success
See Also:
join()

writeFile

public boolean writeFile(java.lang.String filename)
Write the data to an ASCII text file, includes header and fieldnames.

Parameters:
filename - the fully qualified filename destination.
Returns:
a boolean indicating success (true) or failure (false)

writeFile

public boolean writeFile(java.lang.String filename,
                         boolean excludeHeader,
                         boolean excludeFieldnames)
Writes the data to and ASCII text file, header and fieldnames are optional.

Parameters:
filename - the fully qualified filename destination.
excludeHeader - Set to true to exclude the header info (if any) from the output.
exlcudeFieldnames - Set to true to exclude the fieldnames from the output.
Returns:
a boolean indicating success (true) or failure (false)

readFile

public boolean readFile(java.lang.String filename)
Reads data from a file and loads into the fieldnames and data vectors Using this assumes the fieldnames are the first row

Parameters:
filename - the fully qualified name of file to read
Returns:
a boolean indicating success

readFile

public boolean readFile(java.lang.String filename,
                        int nSkip)
Reads data from a file and loads into the fieldnames and data vectors, using this skips the first "n" rows which are ready into the header vector.

Parameters:
filename - the fully qualified name of file to read
nSkip - the number of lines to skip before reding in the fieldnames row
Returns:
a boolean indicating success

public java.lang.String[] encodeSlicesFromString(java.lang.String[] x)
Generate slice numbers from the names of collage_file column

Parameters:
x - a String array of names (collage_file usually)
Returns:
a String array of slice numbers, 1,2,3,...
